context: × 6hours; F = 3.377, P = .013). Also, the difference in time to peak was longer in the HFM compared with the MFM (1.38±0.57hours; F =5.762, P =.031). In a 2-way ANOVA with change in triglycerides over time as the within-participants factors and condition as the between-participant factor, there was a significant main effect of time (P <.001) and a time × condition interaction (P =.018), but no main effect for condition alone (P =.098).Associations between triglycerides, systemic, and airway 8-isoprostane When analyzing the entire HFM and MFM conditions together, there were no significant associations between airway 8-isoprostane, systemic 8-isoprostane, and triglycerides at any time point (P values>.05). When conducting exploratory analysis by condition, total triglycerides AUC, iAUC for triglycerides, peak triglycerides, and time to triglyceride peak were not significantly associated with the change in plasma 8-isoprostane at any time point in the MFM condition (P values>.05). However, in the HFM condition, from baseline to 6hours postmeal, systemic 8-isoprostane was associated with total triglyceride AUC (r =0.874, P =.010), as well as iAUC for triglycerides (r =0.812, P =.026), peak triglycerides (r =0.896, P =.006), and time to triglyceride peak (r =0.804, P =.029). Baseline triglycerides were also associated with changes in plasma 8-isoprostane from baseline to 6hours post-HFM (r =0.837, P =.019).

llm_generation.summary: In this context, 8-epi-PGF2alpha is analyzed in relation to triglyceride levels and their changes over time following high-fat meals (HFM) and mixed-fat meals (MFM). While the study explores associations between 8-isoprostane (a marker related to 8-epi-PGF2alpha) and triglycerides, it does not directly address drug interactions. The focus is primarily on metabolic responses rather than pharmacological interactions, indicating a limited connection between 8-epi-PGF2alpha and drug interactions in this specific analysis.
